quotes.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
quotes.author: Sam Levenson

quotes.text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times if one only remembers to turn on the light.
quotes.author: Albus Dumbledore

quotes.text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: You are the architect of your own destiny; build wisely.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.text: The biggest risk is not taking any risk...
quotes.author: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.text: You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
quotes.author: Richard Branson

quotes.text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: The best revenge is massive success.
quotes.author: Frank Sinatra

quotes.text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt
